title: Heroin Use On The Rise In North Carolina
teaser: More and more Americans are dying from heroin overdoses. We take a look at North Carolina, where 183 people died from the drug last year.
contentencoded:
More and more people across the Unites States are dying from heroin. A recent government report says overdose deaths from the drug doubled in the U.S. during a recent three-year period.

That upward trend is continuing to rise in places like North Carolina, where 38 people died from heroin overdoses in 2010. Last year, that figure soared to 183.

From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Jeff Tiberii of North Carolina Public Radio reports.
